SdNWa-cA5NQEBkSNsHt2vw.text: I had previously left a not so good review on here and here I am again. I was there once again with friends (not my choice)and my feelings have not changed. Food is good but not amazing. We were told we could not have separate bills before ordering. This in itself was a huge inconvenience and to no ones surprise it just caused confusion at the end. Server was ok. She forgot my sons drink I didn't realIze until the end and she didn't seem very happy to be there. I give it 3 stars for the rosemary potatoes and bacon.

n3bvXpXp7t-mwwMTK9aYIQ.text: Pros: They have great food here. I love the bacon they serve! HuGE servings.   Why only three stars?  1.  Their chairs are SO uncomfortable.  I guess they think if their guests are uncomfortable the tables will turn over quickly.   2.  The service is iffy at best. The few times I've been there (usually because I have an appointment in the area) I have to flag down a server for whatever I need. Because they do not check back with you once they have delivered your food.   BUT, the food is really good. So maybe you can overlook the extremely uncomfortable seats and iffy service.

yRg-80eFuqE2bOISbQK4_Q.text: Food here is solid - simple breakfast fare for reasonable prices.  I'm a fan of the Five Spot, which is a tasty breakfast sandwich in a restaurant setting for a similar price to what you would expect to pay at McDonalds.  The reason why I'm giving 3 stars here is service.  The service was about what I would expect to receive at McDonalds.  Actually, McDonalds generally treats me better, so I shouldn't bash Mickey D's.  I asked if there was an alcohol menu (hey, I was there with a bunch of nightshifters hoping to have a pleasant bloody mary with my eggs before going to sleep for the day) and got raised eyebrows, a stare, and a short "no."  Our group also received an abrasive "we don't do individual checks" from our waitress as she handed over the check - despite the fact that we hadn't asked for individual checks.  Not a "hey, did you have a good meal, is there anything else we can help you with?"  No smile.  If a meal is truly extraordinary I'll excuse a bit of rough attitude (ex: most french restaurants).  Matt's Big Breakfast is good, but it isn't unique enough out of all the great valley breakfast options to make me put up with the attitude.

k3OPblqBRgaH5azEBf03TA.text: Very good spot for breakfast. Be warned they put a lot of pepper in their food. I had their Tuesday special, which was a biscuit with sausage gravy, two eggs, and potatoes.

KDa2agQOgWXWR7BtWMEhfg.text: Had breakfast here today - Let's just say there's a reason it's called Matt's "BIG" Breakfast. Had the scramble special. It was full of flavor, cheesy (like me) and filling.   Oh... and the never-ending coffee gave me LIFE!!!   We will be back for sure!

xvq3wiGUIH0HJQFd8CzD-Q.text: Best bacon in town, need I say more? I will anyway, because this place deserves it. I ate so much I didn't eat the rest of the day...I regret nothing. If you're looking for quality food at a great price (and your willing to forgo bottomless mimosas) this is the place.

uiywcXqUqWg0NifSPxoYvw.text: I am a big fan of Matts.  Couldn't tell you how many times I have been.  For some reason the one downtown just executes better.  Came in here and ordered the Thursday daily special: Classic Eggs Benedict with choice of potatoes.  Got the home fries of course.  The hollandaise sauce was way too thick and the muffin wasn't toasted.  Home fries portion was about half of what it should have been.  For 15 bucks the meal was not executed well enough to justify the cost.  This was the third time I've been here and left unsatisfied.    I'm probably not coming back to this location again.

uAe5t4_mgvxE7-bXCPVYYg.text: Big food. Excellent service. Great fresh squeezed o.j. cheese and sausage omelet was good, could have used more cheese. The sausage and back are seasoned with a lot of black pepper so it can get a little hot on the tastebuds. I prefer the ham over sausage and probably the bacon as well, though it was tasty and huge strips if bacon. Hashbrowns were very good, home fries were ok, I wouldn't order them again. Cute simple decor, hard chairs but it helps with turning tables. I paid $1.50 for a side of syrup- that was strange to me. I didnt use hardly any of it, so if I would have, then it wouldn't have bothered me so much, but next time they can keep the syrup. Note I didnt have a waffle or pancake, but still surprising. I would go back again.

CgzoZ-zQwTDj0c9qj9bJRw.text: Everytime I visit AZ I go here. I love the taste and the way that all the food is local. They don't even have freezer or microwave. That is because they make everything fresh.   I always have the omelettes and haven't been disappointed yet. The wait staff are great too.

ii9zDVqb0vQAlDQMzYkOig.text: Loved this place! Such a simple menu of favorites. The peppery bacon was delicious. The toast was huge with the jam. Coffee fresh! I liked it!

6GeIqwIQn7n8l5ynTVOT9Q.text: Matt's has been our breakfast rotation for years now but this was a first for this location. So disappointing, something was clearly wrong in the kitchen. I ordered the Hog&Chick  SUPER extra crispy hashbrowns as my usual. First they brought me the wrong plate all together,  next the hashbrowns were NOT crispy. Barely a crunch to the outer layer and soggy soup for the inner layer, cooked on too hot of a grill is my guess.  Next, the table near us didn't get the right plate then when he did, his eggs were over easy not over medium as he ordered. Lastly a lady across the room received her waffle with no butter, what's a waffle with no butter?!!! It was around 7am on a Saturday so it wasn't actually busy, I can't imagine what a mess it might turn into when it gets busier.  On the plus side Ruby our waitress was very gracious and very very AMAZING!!! I've been on her side and it's never easy but she took it in stride.

hKxb0oTGHrxa0qvzCXIDHg.text: Delicious food. Seating is very crowded and a very long wait for seating. Natural condiment def a plus!

B83MGQ9FFcJyNB_ycsdFzg.text: Local Staple with Great Food  We frequent here almost every week, and the Camelback Matt's consistently delivers great food! My favorite dishes are the steak and eggs (steak is always perfectly cooked) and the chorizo cheddar jalapeno scramble special. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the menu options, and the portions live up to the name. Matt's modest focus on serving great food is a strong contrast to Scottsdale brunch spots that are more style over substance. More than likely we'll be right back here again next week!

TtH8Ad6JZ4Nbltbf7BVmpQ.text: This place was a big disappointment. Was so excited after looking at reviews and hearing about in on diners, drive in and dives but I didn't know that they can't make flavorful pancakes. Their griddle cakes come with 2 ounces of syrup only and you have to pay for more syrup if you need it, when speaking with the manager told her they didn't taste like anything she said they use only simple ingredients: eggs, flour and sugar  No vanilla... no taste and needed to keep asking for more butter but again not enough syrup for these very dense pancakes.  From the response from the manager not going back.. she did not offer to make it right and they weren't cheap

neozD_FkKuRn6CZEWyX9CA.text: Good location in the Safeway center on 32nd and Camelback with easy parking. Interior sacrifices comfort for trend--metal seats, small tables close together.  Not a whole lot of options for breakfast, which is fine if you like to keep it simple like I do. But the food was just ok in terms of flavor and mine was very oily.  I would give them another shot if I was in the neighborhood but I wasn't thrilled with my breakfast.

q0kR7w93lmFPfJ9t6Tf3nw.text: Yes, I was there.  I had breakfast too.  So did my wife.  I had a cheese omelette with a side of bacon.  What I got was a cheese and bacon omelette.  But it was good.  A bit dry, but good.  The hash-browns were really good too.  The iced tea was fresh.  My wife liked whatever she got too.  The place is small, crowded and noisy, but to be fair, there was a large party of large and noisy people seated next to us.  Our server was sweet.  We knew her from another local dining spot, so we chatted a bit.  She was a big fan of Fox restaurants.  So are we.  But this was Matt's, not that other place.    Service was excellent, food was pretty good, ambiance just so-so.  I really don't get places that think the Industrial look with zero sound insulation is a good idea.  Nobody can hear their table mates talking, so they just talk louder.  For someone like me (hearing impaired), it makes it really difficult to have any conversation whatsoever.  I usually just take my hearing aids out and wink and blow kisses at my wife now and then.  Once I missed and I got a really weird look from the hotty soccer mom that was staring at me from the other booth.  I didn't tell my wife.

BNAxN6O25CqSnWgV1rzhMQ.text: I recommend this place to everyone I know. I get emotional from the pancakes. They somehow connect with my soul.

FueSq8b76WTDXY8fy4-few.text: This place is hands down phenomenal! On vacation from Chicago and decided to try Matt's out. They have this strawberry home made preserve that will make you forget all your worries in life. They also have apple smoked sausage that is sweet and savory! Don't forget to try the hash browns!!! Best ever... crispy on the out side soft on the inside , yet not soggy one bit,with all sorts of flavoring! Not just the plain old hash browns you get elsewhere. Local or not, Matts's is a MUST!!!

MaVfO85vk5yWwDfd-YW4tQ.text: Best bacon I've ever had at a restaurant, and I'm a farm girl!!  Everything was farm fresh and high quality...highly recommend.

After all that when paying the bill the stupid waiter asked us to get up and go so that they can seat others. So extremely rude and an awful experience. Never ever will I go back there. YUCK!!

Mrfh3npoRJb9tsnuDK6kjQ.text: Came here on our way out of town back to Tucson. Great breakfast. The breakfast potatoes were my favorite being seasoned with rosemary. My husband had the Hog and Chick and really enjoyed the bacon. I had the Monday special of Green Chile Heuvos Rancheros and it was great. Would definitely come back when we are in the Phoenix area.

V-VmvnjqfAEI4WlipX3zbA.text: The food was not good and special.  The service was bad, we never received refills on our waters.  The cashier was irritated with us when they over charged is by $10.  The cashier was arguing with is on how their calculations was right until i pointed it out to her.  I was very disappointed in this restaurant because i have heard good things about the place.

QX61Qicn3aU8Qwf8T0l7kQ.text: It's just not the same as the original downtown location. The food was good, but the service wasn't as friendly. Granted we came in 40mins before close on a Sunday, so that's partially our fault. But definitely felt unwelcomed for coming in so late. Plus they were out of the steak and eggs Sunday special. :( Lesson learned, come earlier and hopefully you'll get the five star service to go with the five star food.

DJ4LHf4PqaFHWfUghxRwBQ.text: Quite unremarkable. I don't understand the attraction.  I've wanted to try Matt's for a long time. I had heard that they had great Belgian waffles, so perhaps my expectations were high. They were not met. The waffle was served with cold/hard butter - impossible to spread on a waffle. I was hoping for a crispy-on-the-outside - tender-on-the-inside waffle. It wasn't bad... just not what I had hoped for. Served with three strips of peppery, peppery, did I say "peppery" bacon. I am not a fan of pepper bacon, but what made it worse, was that it was limp and barely cooked. It was also served (as stated in the menu) with 2 oz. of Pure Maple Syrup. It wasn't enough syrup for the size of the waffle, so I asked for a bit more. Whoa! - That would be an extra $1.50 charge! I declined.  When the waitress stopped to see how things were, I stated my disappointment at the food and the up charge. She left the table and told no one. What appeared to be a manager also stopped by the table. Again, I voiced my displeasure. She left and told the female owner who returned to my table (a plus for communication). The owner said she would take the bacon off the bill (this was also a big plus).   Then, unfortunately, she proceeded to justify why they charged for more syrup; how much it costs and the long process it takes to produce a small amount of Real Maple Syrup (NOT a plus). I said that I understood the "economics" of it; I just felt that in this day and age of drink refills, etc. that it was not the greatest of customer service. She continued to argue and state how long she had been a restaurant owner, etc., etc. I was not interested. I WOULD have been interested if she had simply acknowledged my feelings and apologized for the fact that I wasn't satisfied.  In the end, she told me she would take care of the bill. This might have been a plus, but she said it with such disdain, that it literally left a bad taste in my mouth. (I DID leave a tip for the server)  Note to servers, managers and owners: Don't argue with the customer - you will never will the battle, or win us over. Don't try to justify your prices/service/problems, etc. - we don't want to hear the reasons why. We want you to ACKNOWLEDGE the fact that we are not happy. Simply LISTEN - then tell us you are sorry our experience wasn't better.  If you can do or offer something to make it better, GREAT!  But do it with a smile. Kill us with kindness - not contempt.

GfBT6jCN6-F1Y_YcUpdrlA.text: I just... what? What's all the fuss about? This is literally one of the worst breakfast spots I've ever been to. Bland eggs, bland hash browns, bland potatoes, bland toast. At least the blueberry jam was nice. Everything I paid $12+ for here, I could have made at home, for better quality. No biscuits and gravy??? I... what??? If you're going to have such an extremely limited menu, you better do it right, and matts isn't doing it right.  The waffle was pretty good however.   Way too many good breakfast spots to ever come back here.

YB-y65zmK5JpRTdq0ZvD7Q.text: Great breakfast spot! Love that they advertise their use of cooking with cage free eggs and real butter and evoo. Makes the quality of food that much better! Came on a Saturday morning around 10 and with a party of 6 I expected there to be a decent wait but within minutes we were seated! Guy working at the front was awesome, very friendly and efficient! Our waitress was just okay but the food was great!! Hubby got the waffles and they were honestly phenomenal. And as for the bacon, I cannot wait to go back and get some more! Bacon was out of this world. Great food at decent prices, I'll definitely be back!

fWVMrautHDTyKYlmCnq_Fg.text: Anyone who gives less than 5 stars clearly hasn't tried their pancakes. This place is amazing, and will always be my favorite breakfast in town!

OYv40xj8CN8CiEJVPP0fSg.text: Was excited to see them join the plaza. Tried the breakfast a few weeks ago, had The Five Spot. Grilled onions on breakfast sandwich is new for me. It's ok, if I had to order it again would definitely so no to it. Today I ordered the Tossed Cobb salad. It was missing the romaine lettuce. I ordered ToGo & when I opened the container I was disappointment. If they ran out, I should have been told& could have ordered something else. I'm hoping it was a fluke & won't happen the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tossed Cobb: Romaine lettuce missing-was not informed that they were out. Very disappointing!!
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot

Xz29bgtKsgvaHVWTer6oZg.text: I just made my final visit at this location. I ordered about month ago, I called in and when I came to pick it up, I saw there was only about 6 people in the restaurant but I waited to get my breakfast I had called in 20min earlier... The girl was nice about it so I wrote it off. BUT today was unacceptable. I called in my order and was told 15 min, I came in and my food was waiting, while waiting 2 older gentlemen came in and right after them a group of 6 came in. The manager came up, gave the other guy waiting his to go order and grabbed her clip board to help the people who walked in 4 min after me.  I would really hate to think that is was because I am a black women and everyone else was caucasian, but that what it felt like. I asked the manager after she looked past me to talk to the man standing next to me, "is someone one going to help me, I've been waiting and I need to get back to work?". She said "Oh we just have some many people, I'm sorry". Not genuine at all and after leaving the parking lot and attempting to go to the ATM I noticed I didn't have my debit card. I had to go back and the same women was at the counter and when I told her she didn't give me my debit card she explain to me where she had laid it down with my receipts to sign, well she pointed to the right of the register when I actually signed on the left and she had every excuse to get me out of there.  Its really unfortunate that people are rude and discriminate against loyal customers. I will continue to visit the semi-org Matt's on 1st st but this location has lost my business and I will not refer any of my colleagues or friends here. The food is good but not enough for me to be treated like a second class citizen, my money is the same color as everyone else's, she didn't have a problem with taking it.

3kI5HHIL3u6DR9VKeRjnRg.text: The food at Matt's is great, and you'll expect it to be based on the wait and the reviews. The portions might not be quite as big as the name, or especially the price, might suggest.

v1QeSg1Fy_XLNEPSgCOYFA.text: It's just a regular breakfast place. I can't say nothing special about it. The food comes in large portions hence the name big matt's. I honestly don't like my food portions that big so I won't be going back. But if your okay with some ordinary and big portions it's a good place to go to.

75rawSNJ2nQtJwXi2q0zVA.text: 2.5 stars. My cheesy chorizo omelette was very delicious but the homefries included, what seemed like, and entire rosemary plant! It was so overpowering even after spending 5 minutes picking out all that I could. Such a bummer! Service was less than mediocre. Never got a refil or a check-in from our waitress besides when she first brought our drinks over. I think I'll give it one more go and make my final review then!

9w6A7g0JFiyN3fl-6QL96Q.text: We love that Matt's opened another location! The food is just as good as the original and makes us love them even more. I always get the waffle and my husband gets the special of the day. The orange juice is to die for and so fresh, I usually end up ordering two large Oj's and then one more to take home (yes I know I might have a problem, too bad there is not AA for orange juice addicts)!

5OsJ611fC8peag5YRUFlUA.text: After all the hype, and an hour wait, I was not really impressed with the menu. I got a cheese omelet which was fine, but not crazy good. The side of toast was the best part-served with homemade jam-I would have been happier with just an order of that and coffee. Went here for the surrounding area which is known for art murals in this part of the city, so overall, was worth it.

duI2PUPGQu7oz1ORzSHcyA.text: Went for breakfast yesterday, the food was decent, I didn't like the home fries, they had a overload of rosemary on them and the waiter told me they couldn't be cooked without them because they come like that, so I switched to the hash brown, they were really good with tons of ketchup. The pork chop was really good, better then I expected, the egg was egg, and the coffee was ok. Probably won't be going back.

XUOrTtuB0hnE01W9yqhEPA.text: Amazing food and amazing service! I only wish we lived closer and we'd be there all the time. The potatoes were so good, I ate every last one and barely had room for the rest of the delicious stuff on my plate.

SlM_Fp1Aidv5_zgjRNGNTw.text: I hate when people compare restaurants, but I'm gonna do it. Matt's is in many ways the opposite of Snooze - it's quieter, the menu is simpler and pretty classic. I loved the decor and fresh flowers in the tables, it wasn't too trendy or trying to hard. You seat yourself. It has a very small business feel to it. The staff was friendly and attentive. I saw a manager on the floor all morning working with them. The food was pretty good - again, this isn't Snooze, so don't expect anything out of this world crazy. Think basic omelettes and waffles.  They have a rotating daily special: Monday's are huevo rancheros, another day is biscuits and gravy, ect.  I think my family's disappointment came with the price - they charge a lot for little things. An extra side of syrup cost an additional $1.50. That just seemed ridiculously expensive. My dad thought it was a marketing ploy to make the pancakes a little dry purposefully so you'd have to order more syrup. Dorky MBA family humor. But seriously. A dollar and a half for a little dinky thing of syrup is too much.

EEoCOnXoZMh1qts26ScIBw.text: I've been looking forward to trying Matt's Big Breakfast. After seeing it on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives we were really excited to try it. We were off to a good start. The wait staff was pleasant and the coffee was terrific. Classic eggs benedict was the special and I was so looking forward to it. Sadly, the eggs benedict was inedible. The poached eggs were cooked all the way through, the Canadian bacon was dried out and there was no hollandaise to speak of. Home fries were soggy and tired. My plate was picked up basically untouched. The wait staff didn't ask and I didn't volunteer what the problem was as we just wanted to leave. My companions had a very average breakfast with soggy bacon. The bill was pretty high. Needless to say, we won't go back. Such a disappointment. The place is really cute.

xAv__I1O0cMjC9Wj4DYl-g.text: Visited on  a Sunday morning around noon and they had line of people waiting for tables. We must have waited for about 15 minutes before we were seated. The girl at the front was very polite and professional. Our server was amazing and continued to check on us throughout our meal to make sure we were comfortable and happy with our meal. It was a second time for me and first time for my husband. I ordered Cheese Omelet (with extra mushrooms and onions) with the side of Hashbrown, Wheat toast and Blueberry jelly with some iced tea. My husband ordered the special of that day which was scrambled eggs with spinach and bacon with the side of Hashbrown, Sourdough toast and Strawberry jelly and their freshly squeezed Orange Juice. The orange juice was very sweet (little too sweet for my preference) but tasted really great. The server brought our drinks in 5 minutes and food came about 10 minutes later. My omelet was very delicious, hash browns were greasy, both jellies were great but Blueberry is my favorite, less sweeter than the Strawberry one. My husband's eggs were too salty. Their bacon slices are nice and thick and extra peppery. Their customer service was great, their prices are a little pricey for their Breakfast menu, if one ends up ordering extra such as mushrooms, peppers or onions for their eggs, the price can go higher pretty quick. Taking 2 stars away for making the food salty and for the price of items, limited menu, loud place. There is no presentation to the food, please ignore the zig zag of ketchup (that was my creation!).  They can definitely work on the menu, their presentation and may be their prices. Time will tell how much they really pay attention to their customer reviews.

KaDy-uI6sNiRAXa5x0RHTQ.text: Pros: food is great! Servers are wonderful and pleasant. Cozy environment.  Cons: The host! Upon getting called for our table, while talking on his phone, he just pointed to our table across the room and had us sit ourselves. After 5 minutes, while we are placing our orders, he proceeded to yell out our name across three tables and said that he called "Melissa" and not "Marisa" and just stared at us. Not sure if he was expecting an apology or just wanted us to leave! Very unprofessional and low class.

aROIGZ5IuL7mHKzG_9n4Fg.text: Delicious, fresh squeezed OJ. Best pancakes I've ever had. Bacon was served crispy and cooked just right. My eggs were a bit more over easy, not over hard but still yummy. Excellent, attentive service. Parking was a breeze. We'll definitely be back for more.

G0PFBEc94ejy5RLUX1RBqA.text: Great breakfast spot. So hearty, quick and amazing service. Felt like I had a good ole fashioned diner breakfast that got classed up in a great environment. Definitely get the country ham!

Ts0am9RzwZSyNx-e4Q8pUg.text: Coffee was so bitter I could barely drink it!! My Waffle was really delicious though. Restaurant was a bit small and not comfortable.

LtdrTW9Xw1M9mSQLjAoqYQ.text: Let me just say that this wasn't my first taste of Matt's. I've enjoyed some of this deliciousness at the Sky Harbor location, but this spot has a much better vibe and the same great food! I love that they use locally roasted coffee (Cave Creek) and everything tastes so fresh. I went in this morning and thoroughly enjoyed the special for today which was biscuits and gravy. It was more like: perfectly flakey biscuit smothered in chunks of sauces with just enough gravy. Someomes this combo can be runny, mushy, taste too fried, or be far too heavy. This dish was none of those. Instead, it's everything you want it to be. Tasty, great texture, and a little spicy. So good!

wZ_Wgjw-FrtnY1L5SMAm5g.text: Ok place. To me, a great breakfast place is high on great and inexpensive basic breakfast fare and low on pretense. I've been to this place 3 times and the food has been pricey and middling..cold, bland egg white omelets, peppery gravy, mushy homefries.  When asked..."how was it?" and I've shared, I have been told "that's how we do it," and ignored for the remainder of my visit.  Plus, almost everything has bacon, can we please have some non pork substitutes? I will state the coffee is good.

Z59W31cmfmpBysdJxSNUNw.text: Outstanding scrambles!  Great food and friendly service.  I ordered the special - a scramble - which was the best I have ever had.  I'll be back.

TuXj8cq-E9PgDUc3NhNOng.text: Today was our last visit to this restaurant. The first time we went was n a weekend, Service Good and the food was very good. We were hooked right away. BUT we have gone there several times in the last few months. Something has changed. This morning we waited for awhile to be waited on. Not many people there so that was a puzzle. Food came. Potatoes cold and GREASY with large springs of rosemary! Rosemary should never be served as large sprigs. OK for garnish but can be a chocking hazard. My husband ordered the Tuesday special.  I can make sausage gravy and biscuits at home that would be far superior to what was served. My eggs were also disappointing. Over Medium were almost hard yokes but still with runny white. Can't figure that out.  Never asked for a coffee warm up. Bye Bye Matt's

UHOg771W6i8Wwm4icEsQ8w.text: Been here a few times, as well as the downtown Phoenix and the airport location, and it's always a treat. A basic, homestyle hearty breakfast, but their bacon is outstanding, can't help but to have second helpings!

M3TEoX-FI8Psh1rnGnbXTQ.text: stopped by here on the way back home to eat something for breakfast while driving so I ordered The Five Spot w/o grilled onions.. it was really good and would order it again, I ate half of it and was saving the rest for later and my wife threw the bag away damnit! also got the honey lemonade and really enjoyed that also

y06viKsfiAbpXGKqpzDA5A.text: I go to Matt's quite frequently because I love the Hog n Chick. You don't want to sit at this two top?" She made me feel like I was inconveniencing the entire establishment. Mind you.. It was a Tuesday morning on a 102 degree summer June day in Arizona....I work in the industry, and I would never act how she was acting towards a guest. So unprofessional. Other than that the staff is great and highly recommend their breakfast.

cL6dzCg_NgSUwI3NSTIi6Q.text: Darn. This could've been so much better...everyone liked their meal except all 4 of us ordered hash browns and were surprised to find that all 4 were under cooked on the inside. When we asked for them to be more cooked, they delivered 4 more the same way: mushy and slimy. When the manager came around, we told her that they were also under done and she said that is how they make them, stating that they want them to be like mashed potatoes in the middle. We overheard the table next to us have the same complaint and she gave the same comment. They took them off of the bill, which was good. Limited menu and service was just ok. With so many breakfast choices in the Valley, we will skip this one next time.

0Eu_PbZwa_P4NEE7bTwDyQ.text: Best waffle with fresh maple syrup I've had in a long time. Also, the honey lemonade is phenomenal.  Excellent service. Apparently it's very popular, but early mornings before 730 are quiet and peaceful.

turIPKp5pZ3dRtDx0k_4dw.text: The bacon is - amazing, thick and perfectly cooked. The waffles are surprisingly delicious. The maple syrup is genuine and not the commercial stuff that you buy at the grocery store. I found Matt's by accident. Then I mentioned it to locals and they all said, "YES!" it's the place to go for breakfast.

ks2JXS7CCnCFElk7dJGG4Q.text: Second disappointing experience at this place in a row.  This time was just poor service by the wait staff who seemed more focused on talking to one another at the coffee bar than visiting their tables.    After sitting down, someone did visit my table to bring me a water.  From that point onward, not a single server visited my table even though my menu was still in front of me and my water was empty.  Servers would pass by without checking in and, at one point, a server even walked by muttering "waiting, eating, waiting..." to all of the tables including mine and the one next to mine even though neither of our tables had ordered anything.    After about 15 minutes of waiting, I got up and walked out.  As I was leaving, my server (though I really have no idea since no one really served my table) said, "Hope you enjoyed breakfast, have a great day."  I couldn't tell but I don't think she was being ironic.  I walked out to First Watch and had a much better experience.  Will not be back.

UYFtw2fQufOcv5jBSLCTeg.text: Good breakfast spot, nothing really special that sets it apart from any other breakfast spot. Food is good and filling. Small location , nice area. I had the pancakes with over easy egg and bacon. Their apple wood bacon is really good.   Overall I give it a 3.9 out of 5   Food: 4 Customer service: 4 Location: 3.8

YlTdmTcCkEaSrpEvQfxqng.text: What a disappointment.  I have been looking forward to eating here since it was on television.  The food was alright at best.  That, however, is not my complaint.   The wait staff was atrocious.  It was painfully obvious that our waitress would have rather been anywhere else.  After we received our food, my mother in law asked for butter for her toast and the waitress actually argued with her about it, saying that her toast had enough butter and she didnt need anymore.  And then she didnt bother to  check on us for the duration of our visit.  If you're going to have such shitty staff, you should have some pretty awesome food to counter.  It is not okay to have mediocre food and terrible staff.

W_7axgQh1_Q-Np7hom-51g.text: This is my Matt at Matt's Big Breakfast!  Delicious and homemade!  We enjoyed visiting on our trip to Arizona for Spring Training!  We will be back!  Arrive early, this place gets busy!

yuIravuzIHRnpEmhfUHuKQ.text: Need more attentive waitresses, you can be good looking but if you can't refill drinks, than it's no great service, when you provide small glasses of water. Best breakfast place by far, First Watch, only problem they open at 7am.

uQmX9chv5Kge3oa7e9VX0Q.text: After spending a whole year thinking Matt's Big Breakfasts logo was too similar to Whataburgers to be coincidence, I finally decided to go out on a limb and check it out. Turns out, the decor is cute and simple...sort of farm house-y. Definitely not what I was expecting! I came around 10am by myself since it was a pit stop before Safeway. The place is always packed, and this morning was no exception. Thankfully, there were some seats at the "bar" - perfect for solo diners. It took exactly 14 minutes for anyone to acknowledge me, and I only point that out because everyone else around me got greeted etc. almost immediately.  I got my order in - the waffle with bacon - and it came out in a flash. I can definitely tell that everything here is fast fast fast. Their menu is not painfully extensive, and they cover the basics and have a sprinkle of unique dishes. Everything looked pretty food, and I would consider coming back to try something else.  My actual meal was delicious. I wouldn't go all out and say it was the best waffle ever, but it was pretty darn up there. The portion was pretty spot on. Looking around, I'd say that everyone else had plenty of food on their plates. Their bacon is thick cut, peppery, crispy on the edges, perfectly fatty, aaaand I need to stop because my mouth is watering.   Overall, food was good, and the prices are reasonable. I would also note that they don't have alcohol (if that's a concern).

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle

-xTbWJfyitdwRewdZoo4SQ.text: Arriving early on a weekend is the best bet.  Crowded places and lines are always a clear sign of a great restaurant, but early birds get the (bacon).  Of course the food is good and the coffee excellent.  The difference for us today was the service.  Rubi made our day and was fast, friendly, and fun.

gQ1jbgvRlPP2RJTbSoEIkw.text: I visited the first location a couple years ago and loved it... food was perfection every time I visited. I finally talked my hubby into trying this place... I was surprised there was hardly a wait at 9 on a Saturday. I soon realized why... this visit was so disappointing. My husband ordered his hashbrowns extra crispy, they came soggy and my waffle was cold. The waitress seemed perplexed, even when I pointed out the butter wasn't melting, even after spreading it out. The second waffle was ok, just no crispy edges like I remembered. Regardless, there was no apology, not even an acknowledgement. My bacon was too burnt to eat (and I love extra crispy bacon). In the end, we left our meals half eaten and moved on with the day. I feel bad for having recommended this place to friends. It's so completely overrated.

DD3OCMpVhBaFiSZDZYktAA.text: Sunday Morning Hunger. What to eat? Sore from the day's prior activities knowing another two mile trek under 100 degree heat to Cardinals Stadium...   Matt's is close to the Embassy Suites on Camelback so Matt's it was.   I told the waitress that I underestimated the food here. She replied with a smile, "it's called Matt's Big Breakfast." I retorted, McDs has a "Big Breakfast" too. Plus many restaurants tout "generous" portions like highly disappointing Stacks in Irvine (OC, CA). I mean/suppose Stacks and McD's portions are large if you are a damn elf!  Service: A Staff is helpful & informative. There is no designated waitstaff. Just holla (politely cause the girls are cute/hot) at anyone. The ice water is refreshing & the coffee was piking hot that needed ice to chill.   Location: A Located next to a market so the parking can be crowded. Especially after 9am. I came earlier b4 everything else was open so parking was cool. Although there was an idiot prius (see pic) that decided to park in front cause he was too stupid to realize there were spots 10 steps away or too lazy to park and walk another whopping 30 steps for whatever he had to do.  Decor/Interior: A/B Metro-ish, Kinda confused w/ industrial.  My visit was filled with older patrons so if it looked like Dennys, that would've suffice.   Food: C Generally, Matt's secret is sugar & butter. Any trained baker would recognize this (I'm an accountant & also a non-practicing baker & bartender).  Hash Browns: A  Commercialized but it was bomb!  Crittercake (Pancakes): C Filling yet bland. Take the sugar and butter over-dose and all you taste is milky flour. Nothing special like cinnamon, or anything like that. The cakes are super hearty. The size is deceiving and much larger than it appears.   Waffle: C My assessment is flawed because I requested no powdered sugar. However, powdered sugar was added but rather than give me a new one, the cook just dusted as much as he can off the one side and flipped it over. The uninitiated eater wouldn't have noticed but when I'm eating, utilizing my sensitive (and trained) palette for flavors, I am focused and in deep initiated. The sweetness in my mouth spiked. I wondered why and flipped the summabeech upside down and bam. That was not cool and (politely) had this convo with the manager who reconciled the situation. She asked me if I wanted another and my face was like =O i have no more space. The waffle was perfectly crafted with the perfect amount of time under the George Foreman Grill (or whatever machine they used).   Bacon (thick cut): A+++ the waffle came with two generous sized thick cut bacon. The source of this bacon deserves a trophy. The bacon was sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo goooooood~!   Steak n' Eggs: A I didn't order this but i tried it. The overall steak was too salty for me, but when my brain disregards the seasoning flavors, the meat was pure. This is off-menu and may appear as the "Dish of the Day" (or some gimmicky name similar thereof).   Toast: A It's not toast, but more like breadstick toasts. Not saying they are stingy here. The toast had a ton of butter on the sourdough but the bread used was an excellent choice.  Jelly: A Here is a little trick for you. Rather than douse your cakes or waffles with syrup, just use a little syrup mixed with the thick jelly they provide here. It will provide an alternative experience for your palette.   Overall: A As mentioned above. Use butter and powdered sugar & this is their secret. If you get bisquick, add the right amount of butter & powdered sugar, then you get Matt's pancakes and waffles at home. The point is that it makes no sense to go to boutique eatery just to eat pan-fried bread with butter and sugar. However, this does not mean Matt's Big Bfast as a restaurant sucks. This is a great joint & i will return.
