LgMdprx8k6C74H2BQ0DjIw.text: This place is awesome! This was our first time here and I decided to bring my kids (teens). We went on a Sunday around 10:15an and it was a line and the lady said it was a 15-20 minute wait...which is the norm for a Sunday. I got their special which was a chorizo omelet with jalapenos and home fries (their specialty) and a tortilla. It was soooooooo good!! Omg! My daughter got their bacon and boy was that delicious! The coffee is strong and good!! The honey lemonade is to die for!! They make their own hot sauce which is AMAZING!! I need to purchase some for home!! We will be back for sure!!

llC9qHpdtj2Z9WQNAAlPpg.text: Absolute worst service. Had 4 different people waiting on us. We ordered coffee and had to remind multiple staff members that we had in fact ordered coffee. The coffee was also horrible. Tasted burnt so we didn't bother to touch it. We were at the back of the restaurant and there was a white board in plain view of our table that said customers had been complaining about poor service which absolutely made sense after the way we were treated. Management was clearly unorganized. Felt like they just wanted us to get in and get out. The food was decent if that. I will never be coming back to this place. Steer clear.

mqxwZ6jA5Jh-SEbBQ-ccBw.text: My first time at THIS location. I loved the original many years ago when I went their. The staff was unenthusiastic/unfriendly and the kitchen had some problems. My daughter's pancakes were remade twice and they weren't able to produce any that were cooked all the way through. My salami scrabble had cool eggs and I was not a fan of the taste of the salami. Home fries were pretty good, though. The bacon didn't hit the mark as everyone who ordered some did not finish it (that never happens with this crew). Disappointing.

lPCJPjq3HuSfL4XB7jidLw.text: Nice place, good food and great customer service.  I was visiting Phoenix for work and looked for a place for breakfast, I blessed to find this place.

_2RrszRrSQMmzB7X3ZzIjA.text: Holy wow! We came for the first time on my Dads Birthday. We splurged and got the steak and eggs, and a waffle to share. It was crazy good. Their country potatoes are the best I've ever had. The steak was juicy and absolutely divine. The bacon was peppery and perfectly crispy. The scratch-made jam...the toast...and the warm maple syrup for my waffle...just wow! Thanks for melting my face! Mmmmmm.

lJVhmap_vh3H3xGYsmAAvQ.text: Went here for brunch a Sunday afternoon. They said the wait would be 30+ minutes but we were seated in much less time. I also enjoyed the water outside to enjoy while we waited. I got a scramble with hash browns. Really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scramble and hash browns

ueWn1jSCgWGObxAHv1uswg.text: Great breakfast place! It's usually pretty packed here, though a little less busy than their downtown location.   They offer your usual breakfast and lunch menu. Nothing weird!  I usually order the cheese omelette with a side of bacon. They have really amazing bacon!  Their hash browns are really good too.   One of these days I'll try lunch, but it's really hard to stray from their amazing breakfast.   Be sure to allow some time, chances are you will be waiting for a table.   Enjoy!

rGMIPiu4V0lQSdRfA_4PWA.text: Although I was an early patron of the Matt's downtown and have also enjoyed meals at the airport Matt's, sadly this location, which is closest to where I live, has not hit the mark in two visits.  On the first visit, my French toast was made with....sourdough bread??  Yuck.  Who does this?  On the second visit, today, I was informed there is no half-and-half or cream for coffee.  No explanation, no offer to check to see if the kitchen might have something.  Just a "Nope!  Just milk!"  What breakfast place is not able to serve the full range of coffee accoutrements?  Also all the wait staff were visibly rushed/unhappy and we could hear the manager reprimanding a server from our table.  Altogether we would probably have had a more pleasant experience at Scramble.

APbXlCSkQpdQAwD6LA9X7w.text: Yum!  I had a scramble and my bff had an egg, hash browns, and the simple little organic salad. Both plates were cleared so...  It seems like this is one of those places where all the servers take care of all the tables as a team. However, no one came to ask us how our food was. Clearly, that wasn't an issue though.   I'd go back, but if you're on a restricted diet at all, I'd suggest checking the menu first. This is why my bff piece-mealed her order.

pivO-Vj4tVD_vUfOJBmxaw.text: This is a long time favorite of ours, all the way back to the OG downtown PHX location. The greatest thing about Matt's is the consistency of the food - it is always perfect every time we go. Scratch made everything. Perfectly cooked eggs, tender breakfast potatoes and the wheat toast is just awesome.   This is the kind of place where they address you by name, and go above and beyond to make sure your service is fantastic. AND they have just started offering their own signature hot sauce -- every part of your experience here is thought of!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special Scramble with Schreiners sausage (local) and their house hot sauce

VER7y46vli8NKmAlkvOb-w.text: This food is great in selection and value. The servings are ample and almost more than you can eat in one sitting. I was thankful for the vegetarian selections and the Grains, Greens and Beans item was so delicious. It was served with 2 poached eggs on top and I had sauteed mushrooms added. The server was attentive in noticing  when my coffee needed refilling. The coffee was very good. All in all, this was a very enjoyable experience and I will be going back.

9z7QgPKHThqA7L3_VIRxkg.text: Excellent food. Waffles and pancakes are light and flavorful. Servers were attentive- coffee cup was never empty.

8ykx-b1uDIeNzQCqm6gFGA.text: Recently moved to Scottsdale and driving home from a doctor's visit and we discovered Matt's Big Breakfast. Great Eggs Benedict, wonderful hash browns along with fresh OJ.  What's not to like.

5xBONtCSML0Tr4eS4og0yA.text: Incredible breakfast.  Great service.  Only the best ingredients are being used here.  Very fresh and cooked to perfection.  Prices very reasonable.

iGrR7va08132MDjux7VfTw.text: The menu is limited but it's because everything they do they do great. Hands down one of the best waffles I've ever had - just the right amount of crispness - and the bacon is always cooked perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p5SSqReVmMz_vTa7swLSAQ.text: I would have given this restaurant 4 stars except they charged us $1.50 for extra syrup. That just seemed petty and honestly put a damper on the meal. Really Matt??  Come on!  What next?  Charging for an extra squirt of ketchup?  The food overall is solid but they should rethink this policy. Why put a bad taste in customers' mouths over a buck?

j-JANcS9Jf6KJUd5Smv1oQ.text: This place is awesome.   I tried the downtown location and this location is just as good,  but bigger.   Line out the door so be prepared to wait.   I got the Salami and eggs with home fries and tortillas.   The salami was excellent.    The eggs were cooked perfectly.   The home fries were great.   My wife got the cheese omelette with hash browns and toast.   The omelette looked average,  but then again a cheese omelette is kind of plane.   Hash browns liked like normal hash browns.   I recommend the home fries.     The toast and homemade strawberry jam are a must.   The people next to us got the ham steak and bacon.   They looked great.     Next time I may just get eggs with toast and bacon because everything will be awesome.

VyGp9F9s3SNCjq1J7qTI-Q.text: I come here all the time!  Simple traditional and organic breakfast served every day! Friendly stuff and fast service. 10 out of 10

a-bM3zIm75IRNi-pFzlefg.text: Updating my review. Been here twice since my last review and seems like they have stepped up their game and the kitchen is rock'n now.   No more cold food and fast service.

vF2M1PKWtcSQ4Bz98KTBVQ.text: The food was very flavorful I wish there was one in the west valley I would eat there all the time

zc510yCkf1eYpjkdTSrDIg.text: The breakfast and coffee were absolutely amazing. Small venue which allows to hear the conversation of your party. The service is excellent. Not a long wait time to be seated. Will return again.

dJg794_cpwoh94PS9XZuzw.text: Love this place.  Food is always consistent and service is a delight.  Waffles and bacon, potatoes, home made lemonade, coffee, etc...  A great place to have breakfast.  I frequent this place often and sad that I'm moving out of state.  But will definitely have breakfast here when in town.

sZf4McOUWODVWJ9ro1lqHg.text: Good coffee, fresh orange juice, delicious waffle, and fabulous brunch. They also have homemade jam for toasts. And I really like their sausage. Downside is there is a waiting line most of the time. However, it's worth waiting for.

GE5MQddD31JM1qmk1gZ-Uw.text: Just had breakfast here with a large group and the service was absolutely terrific! Parker made our experience really special. The strawberry jam was sensational, food was awesome. Highly recommend for breakfast food!!

O0CuK5mUgr9q-1ARrTKHFw.text: Delicious food and amazing service! We got the Hog &  chick, very good thick pepper bacon that I loved. Ask her eggs over easy, should've said over medium.  Just delicious! Potatoes were amazing! Love the rosemary!!

7A44XYGa-Yxwn_763aDgXA.text: Stopped in for breakfast and got the special of the day which was eggs Benedict. They were ok except for the very small amount of hollandaise sauce topping them. The side potatoes were very good as were the bacon slices. Wife has her usual omelet and was very happy with that. Waitress was great, as they are at all the Matts locations. Coffee was perfect as usual.

XUqpLa0ZOqVMb1zk5jAOhw.text: I came here to eat with my family yesterday morning. The food was outstanding, however the service was aweful. The lady that was helping us was the rudest person I have ever met. She was degrading and condescending to my little sister and the rest of the table. She rolled her eyes left and right at us and made us feel extremely uncomfortable. I will never come back to this location again.

QU_UVHOE65bSezpw0rHzyg.text: We had heard so much about Matt's that we decided to eat breakfast there this morning.  The food was mediocre.  My husband ordered the waffle and when he asked for additional syrup the server told us that it would be a $1.50 extra.  He declined the extra syrup and said that it was ridiculous.  When the hostess stopped by the table to ask us how we were doing we told her about the syrup.  She did not handle the interaction well, I pointed out that other restaurants never charge for extra syrup and she basically blew me off and said "we are not like anyone else, and if we did that we would have the raise the prices."  You would be far better off with a price increase.  It became apparent after that, when we received our check immediately,  that someone wanted us to leave because we complained.    This will be our first and last time eating at Matt's.  They can keep their Vermont Maple Syrup, which by the way is not $75 a jug.

AsXleRww7JGbS6yiliAMXA.text: Had a great special today. A three meat scramble with sauteed jalapenos. Cooked perfectly. Wish I had a place like this closer to home. We will be back. Great service along with fantastic food. How can you go wrong

hIOBlDvWXBsxr520s30fEg.text: Food is decent. My only real complaint would be to not go with a group and expect to pay separately... they don't split checks which is ridiculous. There was only four of us and it was too difficult for them to split the bill. We thought it was just the server the first time we went but same thing happened the second time too. They said their software wasn't capable. We then asked them to pretend we each were a table of one; they still couldn't figure that one out. Sorry but not everyone can afford to front the bill and expect their friends to remember to get cash out and pay them back.  They also charge you almost $2 for an extra tiny bottle of syrup. That better be straight from a maple tree grown in the back of the restaurant, haha!

bCQPLJfhBRPH-R3QcxDIbA.text: On the weekend typical 30 min wait. Great omelettes, great waffles, great bacon, and hash browns. But....but... the restaurant always make you feel being rushed by the servers...they keep coming asking can I take your plate?????

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omlettes
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop

XVF00XC9j4axsTu6kSrjxg.text: Have enjoyed this place for breakfast since we moved out son into college at GCU. Now 3 years later still enjoying and food has never disappointed. They have the best strawberry preserves, only problem is they run out, but they have blueberry they are good too but the strawberry are absolutely amazing.   We visited in a Thursday.  Eggs Benedict day!!! OMG yum. These are definitely some of the best eggs Benedict ever. Wish I lived here so I could go on a Tuesday for sausage and biscuit day.    Give this place a try you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict with hash browns. Amazballs.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict with rosemary potatoes. Daughter says best she&#39;s ever had.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham and eggs, hubbies fav.

SiIVy5_RrFmiJdvcyBahzQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has always been one of my favorite breakfast places in the valley. I bring everyone here - family, friends, people from out of town simply because it's a place I know everyone will like.   Unfortunately, I was very disappointed when I came in for brunch the other day. I had the special for the day - scrambled eggs with ham, home fries and wheat bread. The ham wasn't anything great and the home fries were even worse. Matt's home fries used to be my ultimate favorite breakfast potatoes and has inspired me to make a copy cat version of it at home. The home fries I had that day was nowhere near what I was used to. They tasted like they were made earlier that morning and was just reheated in the microwave. They tasted old. My boyfriend and I shared pancakes and what used to be the best pancakes in Phoenix was mediocre. The service as usual was just okay - I've always thought that they were lacking in this department. I don't think I'd come back - there are too many amazing brunch places in the area that are well worth the money.

8Gti3YZrJOO_ctRoT9SJeg.text: One word....RUBY! She is amazing and such a huge asset to this restaurant. Her energy is infectious and she truly cares about people.   The restaurant was great as well. Loved the food and even though it was super busy they were a well oiled machine and got everyone in and seated.   Will be back

YYSF92m9hoNqr-r-k922nA.text: Delicious simple breakfast! The menu is very simple, but everything is well made and taste amazing! The meats are locally sourced and many (if not all) menu items are made from scratch in house. We went on a Sunday for brunch, and it was a 20+ minute wait. The service is fast and efficient and the food was definitely worth the wait! If you're an omnivore don't skip the bacon!

554tZQd4EVlhU5tSlqCC-A.text: This place offers a fantastic breakfast for a fantastic price! I am an out of towner and we heard great things about this place so we had to give it a shot! By the recommendation from the waitress I got the breakfast sandwich and substituted American cheese and pesto sauce on the sandwich and it was the best recommendation EVER. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!! The best part is that it kept me full for the rest of the day and it was only $7.   If you don't get the bacon on your meal then do yourself a favor and order it as a side! I'll warn you though, its a bit peppery!!!   Also the fresh squeezed orange juice is a MUST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich!

eeLDq6an9ImNieppeNF8kg.text: Big breakfast hits it on the nail because the portion sizes are perfect. Not an extensive menu but one that has something for everyone. Clearly it's breakfast or brunch spot, however, the menu items will satisfy a king.   This location services the Phoenix Camelback corridor. Plenty of parking since they share a space next to a major chain grocery store. If your not in by 8am on the weekends plan on a little wait. You have to wait outside as the return to is small and not enough space to wait inside. The hostess staff are always very nice and accommodating. Servers are hit or miss. The food is always perfect and taste consistent. Some of my favorite menu items are the Hash browns, breakfast potatoes, love the thick toast, oatmeal, waffles, and Sunday Steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and Hashbrowns
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal

EVB_lQiUOYxx2fAYAsMdmA.text: Delicious breakfast choices at this local spot.   Because my son is named Matt, I felt compelled to give this place a try.  He even scored a souvenir t-shirt (although there's some question that he'll ever wear it.   On this early morning, the place was 1/3 full with locals; always a positive sign of good food.  There are about 20 tables, plus a few outside in this strip mall location.   Service was quick, efficient, if a bit brusque.   I tried the Hog & Chick - Two eggs, with bacon & sourdough toast. I passed on the potatoes, which are included.   Eggs fried perfectly sunny side up, with yolk thickened but not hard.  The bacon is peppered and thick cut, in nice big slices.  A cup of strawberry jam is served with the bread - tart and thick, almost like a compote.  Delicious on that sourdough.   Amy had The Skinny - Four egg whites scrambled with gruyere cheese and baby spinach and chunks of chicken apple sausage.  Instead of bread, sliced tomatoes.  The scramble was light and fluffy, spinach al dente.  The sausage added a little texture, adding an earthy but not overpowering taste.   Matt's is on the expensive side for every day breakfast, but there are a number of other great choices on the menu and the food is good enough to justify the cost.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hog &amp; Chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Skinny

BAHAjZ9wlWLSIVGk-Q1oDA.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots! We always take friends and family here when they're visiting. The service is great, the servers all share tables so you can grab anyone at anytime for a refill or what-not. I always get the pastrami omelet with hash browns and it's so good. Matt's has my favorite hash brown ever, I don't know what their secret is but omg they're so good!

T_95-jDo0rH4EeZBKXebOg.text: The Good: big portions.  Home fries were awesome.  Strawberry jam was a great touch.   Bacon looked yummy.   Decor was cool and I liked they made their own ketchup.    The Meh: no real kids menu or portions.  Staff was uninspired.  Not sure if that is a hipster Arizona thing.  So. Not a bad thing just is what it is.  I got my food and it was in a timely manner which is key.   The ugly:  nothing.    I would eat here again. But not with the wee one.

vkgB2PuAWabHcujcspT-3w.text: So we tried this different location and the service was great. Very nice staff. But the food although good didn't quite live up to previous awesomeness. The waffle had good flavor but was chewy..portions were really on the small side. With four of us the favorite was the breakfast potatoes and fresh squeezed orange juice. Don't get me wrong it was a good breakfast just not spectacular like before

q-D1zmIJe8vFk2jydxmEWQ.text: Let's get the basics out of the way: 1. Chairs are wide and strong enough to hold big bodies like mine. They're metal so try not to scrape the floor when pulling out/in.  2. Plenty of space between tables to maneuver through the place.   Now for the food: Portions are large so split between two of you don't want to waste or take leftovers. I ordered the Hog and Chick and asked the server to make "scrambled eggs as soft as legally possible." And they were great!  But as I mentioned earlier, portions are large so I didn't finish.   I had link sausages which were a bit sweet and off-tasting so those were added to my friend's doggie bag. One of my friends ordered the bacon and it came out too rubbery so these were added to the doggie bag.   I didn't taste the jam or jelly because I don't like jelly on my sourdough toast. You receive only one slice of bread so make it last.   The hash browns covered the plate and were seasoned well.   The service was efficient and friendly and there was no attitude when I asked for a plate to separate my food.   I would return just because I love the chairs and the service. Thanks Matt's workers!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Hog and Chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and Chick

eVHLpJsV_h0HBjXLOkvMUQ.text: I really looked forward to eating here & was really disappointed that it didn't live up to the reviews. The food was just "ok".  Syrup was watered down.  Food was really bland.  The two female servers we had were angry at life, had permanant scowls on their faces & were annoyed we asked for anything.  I can't see why this place was so packed.

1fV0gRAjBGXczCUMrb4CDg.text: I don't know how you'd ask for a better breakfast.   This place is first rate.   Although, the chairs suck.   They look good, but they suck.     But I didn't come here for chairs.    I came for fresh squeezed orange juice, crispy has browns, lightly made pancakes and killer service.     The place is immaculate and the service was really friendly.  The bacon looks like they cure it themselves;  thick and peppered really nicely.     Even the ketchup was different.   Nailed on all points.    We loved it.    This place is killer.      I'd have sat on a cinder block to get this kind of food.    Easy 5 stars.    We'll be back!

QB84JjJJksYtE9jS1ofmQw.text: Pretty good place! The food was awesome and healthy... well I ordered the 'Skinny' so I was healthy lol. The seating was a little too crowded for me, it felt like I was eating at a warehouse. The ambiance is a little too relaxed so don't come over dressed. There is no bar so come in with your gym clothes and chill-ax. That's pretty much the vibe you get. Void be a great place if they just give there venue a bit more TLC and update the look. The food I ordered was delightful so I would definitely come back for that. The server was a bit snappy but maybe she was just overwhelmed because she was running everywhere but the staff was very friendly overall. A cute little hole in the wall with a chill vibe for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Skinny

-bXdByqcB2MaWHu8lMGCgA.text: I've been to the Matts at the airport and also the original downtown. I was in the neighborhood of the Biltmore store so my wife and i stopped in. Even though it was a Saturday morning and there was a line, we were inside and seated within 5 minutes. Staff was very friendly and attentive as ive come to expect.   I decided on the salami scramble with hashbrowns and my wife got The Five Spot. I am so sold on the quality of the ingredients so i know that each dish will taste like the platonic ideal of that item...i.e. Eggs, toast, coffee.   Really enjoyed my meal...the salami gave the scramble a distinctive savory taste, a combo that works so well. Loved the preserves so much i ordered more toast.  Elevated quality and great service makes MBB at the top of its class.

WYXCGcUgrb9SQtICg9zHNw.text: Stopped in here for breakfast yesterday after picking up my daughter from the airport because she wanted to go to Matt's to get the waffle.   I had never been to this location, only to the one downtown before and after it removed from a small place to another. When I had gone to the one downtown, the breakfast wasn't bad.  This experience, I couldn't say the same. Our server was not what I would call a friendly person. She came to take our order. I was giving my order, and she was asking questions. My daughter thought that she was done asking me questions and started giving her order. The server rudely told her, without smiling, that she wasn't done with me.  And gave her a withering look for effect.  I was a bit taken aback by the way she said it. I think my daughter was as well.  As you can see from my photographs, I would say this restaurant is not all about presentation. Do you see the color of my hashbrowns? It had a gray-ish pallor and looked unappetizing. Perhaps the color was from shredding the potatoes and having them exposed to air before cooking?  My daughter had also ordered the hashbrowns, but the server said they were not ready. When they did come, they were what I would consider regular color for the potatoes. That reinforced my thought that my potatoes were the last of the bunch that they had peeled and grated previously.  My eggs were not anything to write home about.  It was the cheese omelette. Rather bland tasting. I doctored it with hot sauce and ketup. Still blind tasting.  I tried my daughter's waffle. Mehhh.  It was  all right.   There was nothing special about the food nor the presentation and especially the service. There are too many other places that have great breakfast and good service. I don't think I will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omelette with its side order of hashbrowns
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle plus bacon

m-J_13S-nwopJzRS3EAZpA.text: Really reliable and awesome breakfast spot serving all the favorites in a great environment. Had the omelet which was awesome and also saw the French toast disappear really quickly from across the table.  Can be a long line, but they communicate well and have a way of working through efficiently. Small bathroom, so there can be a wait here too.  Overall, great breakfast. Just what we wanted.

jViXHk1rPGdRjFgIjw7ZlQ.text: Service was so amazing ! The waitress are all so pretty (must be a family business) . They are all professional. My food was amazing since everything is local . I can't stress how well my service flow was since I guess it's team service . The coffee was always hot and fresh and their bacon is bomb !

lbsU1Z0arOMljU0n-RexaA.text: Very disappointed by how the manager reacted to a complaint over service from a friend at our table.   Although yes the service wasn't great and it was busy. In which I understood completely. The manager did not handle the complaint well. Instead of just apologizing and letting it be, she kept stating other people's reviews and statements instead of just apologizing. She kept trying to defend the restaurant like our bad experience didn't happen in which made our experience even worse by coming to the table to express her option additionally after the complaint was already made. When the rest of the table was not involved with the complaint. This caused the rest of the group a horrible experience at this location.   Manager just assumed the entire table felt the same as one that complained to her. Made the comment "I was going to give you a gift certificate, but since you said you aren't coming back I don't want to waste it."   Just because one person is complaining about the issues they saw doesn't mean the whole table feels this way. I did not feel like I was not going to come back, but now I don't even feel welcome to come back ever again.   The food is good and the servers are nice and busy. The manager needs to learn to problem solve more rather then become the problem.   I recommend to not state your problems to the management, because instead of taking the complaint and learning from it (like other successful businesses), she will just fight with you about it and try to win. Not worth it.

kTPBpjykRopOT1RyxZOw7Q.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has the best hash browns I have ever had! Their thick cut bacon isn't bad either.  We walked in and were able to seat ourselves. Everyone is incredibly friendly here and welcomes you as you come in. The waitress was quick to grab our drink orders which I appreciated on this hot morning. Just a little tip, the honey lemonade is delicious and so refreshing in this AZ heat. I had the 5 Spot breakfast sandwich minus the onions so it was just a soft roll, egg, bacon and American cheese with a side of hash browns  and my husband had the waffle that came with two strips of bacon. The food came out quick and it was very filling.  The atmosphere is casual, comfortable and very welcoming. Service is friendly and very efficient. Don't miss out on checking out this little gem.  Breakfast for two ran about $24.00, not including tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

voqWIr7I9pyQocCMP4HxLA.text: Went here this morning for breakfast with a friend. Waited about 10 min to get a table, not long. The honey lemonade was amazing. I ordered the special, French toast... It was crispy, moist, and delicious! I wanna go back next week! Lol   Service was good, food came out timely, correctly and cooked well too.   Prices are average for breakfast place.   Overall I really liked it and being my first time here, now it won't be my last!

E998UcznfnK7RsA8PUe01g.text: Amazing breakfast. Just as good as Tempe location and just as busy. Waffle was outstanding.

0wWSU3oFRCg-pL3J45Mfjg.text: Back in the day we stood in line for an hour and a half to stick a fork in one of those fabulous, juicy, tasty pork chops and were happy to do it. Flavors were fabulous and portions were huge. I think success has meant a lot of watering down. A while back I ate in the airport terminal and had a bad experience which I attributed to the rush of dealing with airport traffic but the pork chop I had this morning was dry and tough here at the Biltmore location. My wife complained about her's as well and for the same reason.   She declared her hash browns average but loved the toast and home made jelly. I thought the home fries were fabulous with lots of onion and nice crispy brown edges on the potatoes. So good. The iced tea was great and the servers kept my glass filled so that was good. Other than the dried out chop, the food was fine. My real problem is that it simply isn't as great as it used to be. The experience is kind of like the candy bar as big as your head that you used to get for $.99, but now it is a third the size for the same price. You're not disappointed because, you know, chocolate, but it just doesn't measure up to what used to be...   We kind of decided it's not really worth the wait.

nJSqZE69fHyi_jOEHZ-Eug.text: The best pancakes I've ever had!! Definitely a place to visit for good brunch with the whole family

rJW7srTs-1oXBufqKEOqZQ.text: Matt's is awesome for breakfast. Go hungry because the portions are large. I really like the ham steak and eggs. There fresh jam is also amazing. The breakfast sandwich is fantastic.

OoVqd3qs08vuuSh8zlcg9A.text: Absolutely love this place for breakfast! Service is excellent and the food is amazing. I think it's the best breakfast spot in the Valley!

IVuQ4l2Ph98qQ2j8zkM1Wg.text: Was in town early March and looking for something to do for breakfast.  Matt's did not disappoint.  It was a Saturday morning and we managed to get in before the crowd but by the time we left it was packed.  Portions were perfect and the service was outstanding.    There was a good selection of breakfast choices and the lady beside us even asked about a BLT lunch sandwich and they said they could do it!  Our food came out in good time and was fresh and very well seasoned.  The breakfast special was incredible and the potatoes were perfect!    Will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

TUcyHvUvEkWV1M41sUlkgA.text: Have been wanting to come here for months. Consistently spoken of as one of the best breakfast joints in Phoenix. Happy coincidence that I was downtown in AM on Eggs Benedict day! Ambience is casual just like I like it, but the Eggs Benedict were first class. Delicate, homemade Hollandaise, real thick-cut Canadian bacon (not just thin sliced Lunch meat), toasty English muffin and perfectly cooked eggs. Hash browns were crispy & fresh--and plentiful. Can't wait to come back again and try more items from the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DdnONCazvc0qlwjJmgU0rA.text: Been to this location twice and both time have truly enjoyed my experience. Service has always been great.  The food is simple breakfast done right.    You can't go wrong with Matts Big Breakfast. It can get pretty busy here so if you come during the rush expect to wait 30-40min as it's a small location to begin with.

kvNxuUW7ZmrspgJ-vdZFYw.text: Awesomeness from Matt pool yet again.  Packed to the rafters with egg and bacon lovers....plus much much more!  This place is equally as cool as the downtown location skewing a tad older and a tad less hip but that doesn't make us any less hungry or appreciative of great food.  Thanks Matt for making it over here!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V0n7OOzAQnccBKqx3itkZA.text: The menu is limited but the food was good. There were only a couple of healthy options so I chose the oatmeal with a side of bacon. Both were good. The person I was meeting said the pancakes were great, so good he ordered an extra cake. Service was good as well.  I'd be willing to try it again for lunch or when I didn't want to eat healthy.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

857VVmIigxISK4PBtFaG0Q.text: The restaurant is cute and the menu is original. The place was really busy but the service was quick, short food wait time, and the service was friendly. Expect it to be loud since a lot of people enjoy eating there as much as we did. Great place to visit for yummy breakfast!

klzhXmqxtg4Sq7uhn1OH_g.text: I would rather have medium poached eggs and wheat toast here... than any dessert offered worldwide.

sWVnNi3vCzYyubQ7AOQ7vw.text: General rule of thumb: condescension toward your customers is never a good look, but if you're going to try it anyway, your quality better be damn good. Unfortunately, at Matt's it was just ok. Want half and half in your coffee? Prepare for a lecture from the waitress (who has been alive for fewer years than I have been drinking coffee) about how they only offer whole milk, but it's organic and you will be surprised by how delicious it is if you give it a try. Want salami in your omelet instead of ham? They charge $5 extra because the salami is "really high quality." Never mind that the salami scramble on the menu costs less than an omelet with ham.   Sometimes there are really legitimate reasons why restaurants can't fulfill a customer request, but here it's just pretension. Next time I'll be having my breakfast at a place that asks me how I'd like my coffee instead of telling me how I should.

V-kk0Z91YDiR1Ie59BbpJg.text: *****. ++++++++*First this is not s big breakfast if you are hungry do not go here!!!   Got a waffle and two slices of bacon i didn't want and it was 8.99 i couldn't swop for sausage  without a charge. There hot pastrami tasted like they dumped a bottle of salt on it . i went there because of reviews . after spending 27.00 for two people  before tip and walking out hungry i would never ever ever go back or recommend. total money making  R I P!*********

Gxo0Qn4_oZyBWiWfYIIHSQ.text: Super cool inside and the food was really really good. Their bacon is unlike any other bacon I have had. So you must get that whether you get that on the side or your actual meal. I had the hog and chick with bacon. Go go go!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The hog&amp; chick
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict

PknXZYFthaFsMRjJwcsgVQ.text: Seriously? Matt's big breakfast has been open for how many years and yet they still treat their customers like absolute trash.   For whatever reason the manager came over to check out my pick up order. So he walks over, looks me up and down, and gives me a very judgemental look. Then as I was paying he would not look me in the eye and used a very disgruntled tone. Did my business annoy you somehow? I literally was in the actual restaurant for 2 minutes and yet I walked away this bad.   Shame on Matt's. They are better than this. I will never be back. The food is overrated and the service is literally worse than what I would expect from a McDonald's.

sQf1HyXT_o-vZ9tNLVf1uA.text: I've heard great things about Matt's so my expectations were pretty high. They have a very simple approach and their menu seemed very natural and homemade  which I liked. I honestly think that's what adds to their charm. The bacon is thick and very tasty. My husband loved the home made strawberry preserves, we even asked if they sell it to take home but they were out. I plan on going back and buying some when they have more in stock. All in all it was good but OBH still continues to be my favorite bfast place in PHX.

Rr6F2kLvocKk6sZxpMTNWg.text: Great place to eat if you're HUNGRY  The portions are big and the taste is flavorful. The staff is amazing and super nice. Although the wait time was a little on the "ALMOST too long to wait" side, I love this place and will eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uGwG2Jq6bWXUIByyR9zDDg.text: I don't feel like my visit here really compared to all the hype online! The ambience and way the room is set up is very strange. All the tables seem to be crowded, facing different directions and the seating is not comfortable. When my friends and I walked in we were told to seat ourselves and we were greeted by 3 different servers on separate occasions so it was very unorganized. The menu was underwhelming and the food was just decent. Wouldn't be my first choice for breakfast!

0jxwWlCGIPNokNuYczNotw.text: Was initially excited to see a Matts location in Scottsdale, even tho I don't get up there often. I remembered the menu at the downtown location used to have some unique offerings so was disappointed to see that this location's menu is pretty much the same as many other breakfast places.  Decided to order the cheese omelet and hash browns...and even though I added mushrooms to the eggs, they were pretty tasteless, and they had no salsa... Really? In Arizona? The hash browns were so greasy I couldn't eat them. All in all a big disappointment. I think I'll pass...

xcR7h4C8de7f6xir30K4yw.text: Amazing food! Bacon to die for. Had to hunt staff down for coffee, but they were sweet and super busy. Can't wait to go back.

wmH6uCk8Jz-su4Uh-fPqsw.text: I'm a breakfast guy. I love breakfast. Like a lot. This place was worth the wait, fresh flavorful food served by a friendly crew. I had the special which was a scramble and fully satisfied me but the piece de resistance was the waffle. Most waffles are good, there's an expectation that gets met, but this was hands down the best waffle I've had! A unique flaky texture with real butter and maple syrup. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Phoenix

GqHrSXToB1I98hk0pK8m0A.text: Been to the 32nd st location a few times, been to the downtown location a few times....great food at both locations, what I appreciate is the consistency.  Some of my favorite bacon of any restaurant.  Had the Hog & Chick (bacon, scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast).  Everything well prepared and tasty...the strawberry preserves for the toast was good.  Coffee and OJ completed the meal.

1gHAHy-nsYqVBuEOhY1naQ.text: Had a lot of breakfasts at Matt's, but this morning was terrible.  Found a hair coming out of the top of my wife's omelet like a weed.  They apologized, but they didn't comp the omelet.  WTF???  Bad management.  Won't go back. Yuck.

RyYbvEl9rNghz6LtviKmYA.text: So I was excited to find out there was this location.  I visited the one downtown a few times and it was always amazing.   I came to this location and first off my waitress was so weird and like high, she's like I'm sorry I just need coffee. Im like okay, we ordered food. I liked my boyfriends rosemary potatoes the best. Everything else sucked. My bacon looked great but fell apart when I bit down,  too hard and too crunchy for my liking. Beef jerky would have been better than that bacon.  The waffle was okay.   Overall, disappointed. I was so sad walking out.

ts2CSispyw1QHqWIhBO0UQ.text: We came here for breakfast while vacationing in Phoenix, heard some great things mainly about the freshness of food and how delicious it is. I orders the cheese omelette with hash browns and my husband ordered the Five Spot sandwich. Everything we ate was so delicious! Some lad we came here, seems like a great local gem from all the regulars that were there. Definitely recommend!

vxp7EldixhFXSTibM7i33A.text: Local breakfast spot. Awesome. My wife loves the Waffles. I tend to get different things everytime and the eggs are bomb. There's almost always a short wait but that goes by quickly.

_5C6TtgpCHzt8JgKqcQP7w.text: The best comfort food I've had in some time. MBB nails it! Everything I ordered was prepared just the way I like it. I think I've just found my new favorite breakfast place.

UUdxeS2KGsVg6_4HmicbRQ.text: Just found this place on a drive up Camelback Rd.  Great vibe, great food and really wonderful staff. 3-egg scramble full of bacon, spinach and a little cheese...homemade strawberry jam, hash browns cooked the right way.  My coffee cup never cooled down! All this for less than $20...

entiPeam9gnihZ61mKCFlQ.text: Solid food.  Pancakes are super fluffy and tasty.  The maple syrup is incredible.  Fresh oj yes! Really friendly staff. Will repeat.

4cE7sLgZCKXu5apCcc67Ow.text: So sorry to say but won't be back after waiting several weeks to try. The service was horrible, had to ask someone when we could place our order. My husband had the Cobb Salad and they must have not had lettuce left so they chopped up lots of the core. I told him to send it back but he didn't want to wait again for a new plate. I had the egg with bacon, cheese and onion. The bacon was dry and burn't and the sandwich on a whole was cold. We won't be back anytime soon.

02yCOQAVB7qSNnBXZKEu2w.text: Pro: Huge stack of beautiful pancakes. Con: Thimble of syrup, and you have to pay for more. Weak. And why do waffles include a side of bacon, but the pancakes don't? Isn't it the same batter? A steakhouse-style a la carte approach to breakfast seems like hustling backwards.

kK0TTEMvNY39hnduxvc5qw.text: The waffle is the best! The bacon is thick cut! A must come to when visiting phoenix. There was 20 min wait though

Ip9u3zdk5EXtlscnRRDHng.text: We are a big fan of Matt's Big Breakfast Downtown. Food is amazing, even though the wait is frustrated sometimes. I love their 3 eggs scramble special. Also the waffle is delightful. When they opened new one in Camelback location, we were so excited since its much closed to where we live. Even though same owner and menu, the food is not quite the same. May be just my taste. Anyway,  Matt's Big Breakfast is still one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix metro!

WE2Ilof4OXJ32uhJcoYSJw.text: Everything here was amazing, from the service, to the food! This includes the coffee. From the time I sat down, ordered my food, and received it, it took 10 minutes. The eggs were some of the best I've ever ate. I'll be traveling back to this area in a month, and will be hitting up this place.

JG50QAP-bgt-x7o79odbMw.text: I have only been there once, so I will probably go back to give it another shot, but I can tell you that I had a very basic breakfast, and it was good...but very overpriced.  $11 for scrambled eggs, toast and potatoes?? I'll give it one more shot and try something with a bit more substance, but for now...I think there are other places nearby that I would lean towards before here.  The only major upside is that it's close to the same parking lot as my office.

BmsO-QXrUU-VITohIWN-mQ.text: My wife and I enjoyed the food at Matt's. The hash browns and homemade sourdough bread was amazing!

hXmdLxJw5qNp5myGzLftZw.text: IMO this is currently my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix. The menu is pretty basic and straight forward but everything I've had so far is absolutely delicious. Even just a cheese omelet and hash browns with toast is incredible! The decor is very cute and it's a seat yourself kind of place.

FFTLrf6M42C6RNnm89J27g.text: I was starving after my breakfast meeting this morning so I stopped in at Matt's since I am not usually on this side of town. Service was great and the breakfast potatoes with rosemary and onions were yummy. I also love the homemade preserves with the toast.  The nicest part was I was writing a letter to my son on the back of the paper placemat and the server was so sweet to offer me another placemat to finish my letter. He even made sure I didn't forget the letter when I left.

zyqdB7uffYDY7GUAjsEy1Q.text: The low down: Small Menu , fresh local ingredients, long wait...  Food Ordered : The Skinny (4 egg whites scrambled with gruyere cheese, local organic baby spinach, and chicken apple sausage cooked in olive oil and served with a simple little salad) - the scramble was very good but had a few shortfalls - they were 'skinny' on the egg whites and over compensated with too much gruyere. The simple salad was simply tasty and refreshing.  Waffle (made from scratch Belgian style waffle, sweet cream butter and real maple syrup with two slices of thick-cut bacon) - basic breakfast selection that didn't disappoint.  Overall we were satisfied with the newer location. However, they did not start our experience off on the right foot. There was a 30 minute wait to be seated so we went next door to get a coffee. When our table was ready they told us we could not bring in our coffees but could sit them at the front of the restaurant due to "health code violations"  (No such code exists) so word to the wise, if you don't want to waste your $6 Starbucks coffee then I'd skip going there while you wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sxE9V3oIOITzzcWgkq3yZA.text: Great breakfast at Matt's Big Breakfast.  Arrived at 9:20 on a Friday, perfect timing to avoid the morning rush.  It was busy but we were seated right away.  Went for the Friday scramble.  Home fries were very flavorful with carmelized onion.  Eggs and sausage also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Friday scramble.

yktDZOSst2lpZnHR7_lCKA.text: Super cute place to get brunch! We ate at the Camelback location. I saw this place featured in the Phoenix magazine and was excited to try it. It was very busy, we were told a 50 minute wait but only waited 30 so that was nice.  I had the cheese omelette with breakfast potatoes. I added mushrooms - it was excellent and the portions are big. I could've eaten five plates of the breakfast potatoes. My boyfriend got the pancakes and loved them, said they were very filling.   The service is great. Our coffee mugs were never empty. Everyone is your waiter/waitress so you can ask whomever to help you. They were all friendly and efficient.   The only reason Matts doesn't get 5 stars for me is because the seating was so uncomfortable. We sat at a high top and the stools are hard metal squares. Maybe I have a big ass but it was not enough room and definitely not conducive to wearing a dress. Space is also cramped.   If you can avoid the high top seating, I highly recommend Matts!

_shDjodSCkiJOTtsswlwmw.text: Truly an awful disappointment. Service flat out sucks. The 1st time my wife and I are here there was an insect in her food. Instead of yelling fire in a crowded theater I quietly notified the manager. His response? "Our food is organic, local and sometimes this happens." WTF? NO! It means you're not washing your greens before cooking you dolt! DISGUSTING! Matt's breakfast is all hype and no substance. The only thing big about it is the check. Go elsewhere.

t_H0x_Gdfy9Oxd2x8JUr2w.text: Yum yum yum! Classic breakfast done right. Do yourself a favor and get the hog and chick with cheesy scrambled eggs, rosemary potatoes with onions, bacon and sourdough toast. What else do you need?!

LXQVBXfSNQfkVTFkP3_lwg.text: Big breakfast is a bit of an overstatement considering you can get the same-size meal or a larger one at a chain breakfast joint for less. Really, the only thing big is the check. Talk about overpriced!  The food is okay. The pancakes are very light and fluffy, but the hash browns were soggy and gross. I don't think the coffee was all that fresh, either.  The customer service is also lacking. I almost got the feeling that my table was being avoided. I sat without water for almost the entirety of my meal while a server walking around with a pitcher visited every other table. I guess I'll be sure to bring my own water bottle if I ever come back!

OOe7VuFKMNflfHyW1d5Xcg.text: The food is excellent. I love the potatoes with rosemary! I had the egg scramble with jalapenos, sage sausage and peppperjack. Portions are excellent size! It even came with a bonus tortilla. I easily had enough for 2 meals. My only complaint was it took my waitress a bit to refill my water, and in this heat, it was missing it, but then someone else filled it for her and as a team they kept it full for the remainder of my visit.

tVwEOdMgrfJwyDVJmueP6A.text: Smaller location. Good service times. Friendly staff however they are quick to have to in and out, not recommended for longer breakfasts. Good if you are in a rush.

SYy9oA8dNw6_CQ9k8RAqAw.text: This is a great option for breakfast. The service was great, the food and pricing was awesome! I got the waffle which came with bacon. Danny got the breakfast sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it. Even the butter used for the waffle was yummy and I'm very glad we went here. One of Danny's favorite podcasters recommended this place and I am sure glad he did. The place looked urban and clean. Lots of use for wood and metal. I would recommend this place, they came around filled our waters and coffee often. We were also seated right away and got to choose where we wanted to sit. When we were leaving, it did look like there was a wait for forming. So try to come early if you can !

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1h51kWQcs0EvnfYmBhLxVQ.text: So disappointed.  We love Matt's big breakfast in downtown Phoenix.  We come here for vacation and always go there. We decided to go to different location on camelback since it was closer to our resort.  Food was mediocre.  So sad.   Omelette was weirdly slimey.  And everyone's hash browns were cold in the middle. And even their waffle was cardboard.   The bacon was tough as well.  Home fries were ok. Service was so-so.   Not sure why the food wasn't good. I do want to say we have always enjoyed their food.  But won't be back at least to the one we went to.   Sorry Matt's.

6x_0a-imkats0KFJdyvZiw.text: Finally made it over to Matt's Big Breakfast, and I'm glad I did!  This place is your quintessential get-in/get-out breakfast joint, but with local ingredients in a clean open atmosphere.  We ordered the breakfast sandwich (bacon, marinated onions and american cheese) and salami scramble for breakfast.  The scramble came with a choice of hash browns or home potatoes, so I went with the hash browns.  I must say, I think those were my favorite part of the meal!! The outside of the hash was super crisp, and the inside potatoes were luscious and almost creamy tasting. 10/10 would order again.    Service was also good.  Our waitress was fast, sharp and on point.  She was good about keeping our water and coffee glasses full, and I appreciated the amount of times we were checked on.  All in all, I had a enjoyable quick breakfast, and look forward to going back to see what else they have to offer :)

ex4SVqTOxBoid3msPIx0BQ.text: My favorite breakfast place in the entire world (and i am a New Yorker who has been to many breakfast places). The eggs are amazing but the hash browns and toast are incredible. The toast is the best toast i have ever had in my life and i wish i could eat it every day!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JET5aK6zKpkhVNWuO1qoJQ.text: Everything everybody says about Matt's is True. A fabulous breakfast with good service.  The hog and chick is the way to go. Go after 9:30 during the week to avoid wait time.

D_EjcLQjc9uhRpGD7S62_Q.text: First time here and I was very impressed!   Really wanted an omelette and great hash browns and that's exactly what I got. Everything from the house made jelly preserves, to the organic chocolate milk, I fully enjoyed all the food.  The server was a little slow but I understood because it was a packed house, the lovely manager and food runner with short hair were helping us with whatever we needed and we appreciated it!   I will be back for the amazing bacon however, perfectly peppered and thick, just how I enjoy it!   5/5.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome ceramic check presenter.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese omelette with added bacon, and crispy hash browns.
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House made strawberry preserves with fresh sourdough toast.

y8ihyqp-QZgR7RMbT_9mXQ.text: This place is my favorite breakfast place in Arizona. The food is delicious and made with high quality ingredients, the atmosphere is perfect, and the service was prompt and friendly.   If you like breakfast, you'll love Matt's Big Breakfast. 12/10 would recommend.

PTvQ09-SigB2GBhftCKIvg.text: Our GO TO Breakfast joint. I am obsessed with the bacon and waffles. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu honestly.  The staff is so nice and welcoming.  The downtown location is a very fast paced atmosphere but the Biltmore location is more relaxed. I recommend the Biltmore location if you don't like waiting and don't want to feel rushed.

Q4uVK82GyanON-9CPszncw.text: Nothing big about this place. When I see BIG breakfast I'm thinking that there will be large portions of food. Not the case. They even serve sodas in a can for $2. So if you are thirsty you better get some water or ante up another $2 for another can. Food is ok, nothing to write home about. The staff is very friendly.

zxBSHx280B3KGTY-HFESWg.text: Good food and Great Coffee.  Really busy so the service was a little slow.  We had to ask for more coffee.

m-FVfnD5ZAUPZvddLoZEzw.text: Saw this place on Diners Drive ins and Dives.  It did not disappoint.  The food was delicious and plentiful and reasonably priced.  A great way to start off our trip to the Phoenix area.

pd5wGOlk2trenDIjyO5Wbw.text: Good old American breakfast. Best item was the toast and jam. Many places seem to serve the smuckers jam packets but theirs seemed homemade

WGx1DaL7lnwVlaGAKXlrxA.text: Excellent service and great portion size.  The bacon is out of this world!  The weekdays aren't as busy as the weekends. Overall the food is reasonably priced and high quality.  This was our first time and we are definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy...The Hog &amp; Chick

UvHGRG0ZMNDy6G7HoofuXQ.text: Overall delicious food. I am not a breakfast person, but I wound up going here for a family member's birthday and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Five Spot, an egg and cheese sandwich with bacon and onions. I loved it. It was extremely satisfying, great service from the waitresses, and fairly reasonable prices. The only downside was that it was very busy and the menu was very limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot

kidF6HkjSDZB4DbFLBnmCw.text: Really delicious food, but the wait can be really long. Try and get there early or on a weekday, or often they can have single counter seats available

fu7TkV6DGO9rEiYt1pdl8g.text: A little late delivering the water, but it was Sunday morning crowd.  Please tell me though, does anyone know how to cook a poached eggs in Phoenix? I keep getting overcooked poached eggs. It is very disappointing. Overall the food was tasty. Just not a big wow.  Note: when I went to pay I mentioned my eggs were overcooked, and the manager reduced my bill by half of the most expensive meal.

qh1tiIR34xhLVyYleCL8ZA.text: I'm not sure what happened but Matt's Big Breakfast on 32nd St it is NOT what it used to be.  We used to love their food and service on a Sunday Morning.  This time the quality of the food has dropped and the service wasn't the expectant smiles from servers we always received in the past. I ordered the Chick and the Hog and the bacon was undercooked and my wife's was also undercooked. The coffee was way too strong and when my wife got to the bottom of hers there were coffee grinds on the bottom. I couldn't even finish mine.  The service was a mixed bag, also. The hostess while friendly and smiling couldn't keep straight which customers arrived first to seat them in order. Then our unsmiling waitress took our drinks and order but never came back once to check on us. She even had another waitress bring us the check. I hadn't even complained about any of this until the 2nd waitress arrived with check and all I mentioned was the coffee. She did take that off the bill so Yay for them.

cerSiHDrkcUvpTFIXkO31A.text: Everything about this place is amazing!!! The food, the atmosphere, the staff, the food, did I mention the food?  My family of 4 all picked something different, and we all said ours was the best, so of course we had to try everyone else's.  We were all right.  You can't go wrong, there is something for every pallet and appetite.  It is cozy, so be prepared to wait and sit close to other satisfied diners.  We lucked out and sat next to an amazing retired couple from Sacramento.  Eat here NOW!!!

7bHgdEmsPsWtMX63IEYQwg.text: Pretty nice breakfast spot. Went here at around 10:30am and it was busy, but not packed. Waitress came to me right away for drink order and gave me the special of the day. I ordered it. It was delicious and came out pretty quickly as well. Menu options are pretty typical breakfast. I contemplated the salami egg scramble but was worried about quantity. I did not really browse the lunch side but looked to have burgers, sandwiches and salads. It's a consistent good place to eat. Last time I was here was a few years ago at the downtown location.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. biscuits and gravy. The Tuesday special.

1vDQbeo0ep_SYSSoh9E5WQ.text: Eh. Nothing to rave about. Service was great but food was just okay. I def wouldn't eat here again

E9CagtzLbjGqqH0A0OIy7Q.text: Line went down quick. Food was great . I had the special with pork , cheese, and bacon. I will be back when I visit Arizona again.

-01ePuKPxMw1bhR4ISbIlw.text: Been eating at Matt's Big Breakfast since they were at their original location downtown.  Always busy with a line to get in but great places are like that so if you want to eat quickly go to Dennys so you don't have to wait so long.  Everything is made from scratch and fresh. The Waffles are outstanding as are the Griddlecakes.   I am a really big fan of the Big Butter Burger also. The burger is just plain good and when they bring it to you, you will be happy.  If you can, make sure you get some bacon here which is very good.  Service is good and the new location is spacious compared to the original restaurant.  What is nice is that the small feel still transferred to the current location.  Would recommend going there either early in the morning or later prior to closing to minimize your wait.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waffle with bacon
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog and Chick with Ham
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Five Spot with Hash Browns

5SiD5E-f8CvJRO6s_dE6-w.text: HOLY PORTION SIZE. Has your wife ever recommended a breakfast place to you? and you didn't really want to go because you were incredibly hungry and you KNEW that if you just went to Denny's you would get what you paid for? WELL have no fear! Matt will hook you up with the biggest, best tasting breakfast of your life. You will not leave hungry. The breakfast sandwich was delicious. Would recommend. Unfortunately, we weren't smart enough to order the fresh squeezed orange juice... but if we would have... I'm sure I would recommend that as well. Good job, Matt.

BttFvULcywtL6q3hBbCrJw.text: Been here three or four times this year for breakfast.  Their food is very good and the portions are quite generous.  I usually split one of their omelettes and the country potatoes are delicious.  The jam for the toast is outstanding and their coffee is solid as well.  Get here early to avoid a wait on weekends and you're good to go.

Yj6dSjdikKQgEKqyvzpLHg.text: What can I say about this place. 0D2V7EihrFf7ioXMCpaNUg.text: Imagine the original Matt's Big Breakfast, only in a slightly smaller setting. The menu is the same, the food is the same, and the service is the same. The only difference?  Now, you actually have a place to park your damned car!  We've been waiting on this Matt's location to open for quite some time to the point where they were so far past their originally projected launch date that I had almost forgotten about it. And then, just on a whim, browsing through Yelp, I noticed that it had quietly opened its doors back in January.    Honestly, there isn't really anything I can say about Matt's that I didn't say in my review of the original location. The breakfast served here is what I consider to be the gold standard. It's traditional breakfast food that thrives on simplicity, without the need to be annoyingly trendy with stupid gimmicks like 500 different types of omelets or offering up liquor at 7am in the morning. Keep it simple, keep it good, and ultimately, you don't need all that other crap to keep customers coming back for more. Now, if you're used to only going to breakfast places that offer a Bible-sized menu of dishes to select from, this might not be the place for you.  In my opinion, you really can't go wrong with anything, including the thick cuts of peppered bacon, butter-infused hash browns, homemade jam, and various honey lemonades and orange juice. The quality of the food at this location is consistent with what we've come to expect.  If you come during busy weekend hours, don't expect the addition of an extra location to have an impact on wait times. It's just one of those things that we've all learned to tolerate. Good food can't always be kept secret, unfortunately.  In some ways, I do see this location as kind of an odd choice. It's not really very far from the other Matt's, so it's not like anyone is pocketing all this extra gas money by going here instead of downtown. But in the end, who really cares? Matt's could open up a location at the bottom of a tar pit and I'd still give them five stars for the food alone.  It's simply the best!

1U6rIQwx0axXVri5-TMnSA.text: Everytime I visit Phoenix I try to visit Matt's. It has my favorite pancakes. I would recommend the home fries over the hash browns. gP9qs2HiuF4fgZ83wmKxDw.text: Ok so I heard great things so maybe the bar was set unreasonably high. OVysdK4KM_dIGMq5OhAZdw.text: Matt's Big Breakfast has fresh squeezed juices and big portions. My cheese omelette was chock full of lots of cheese and the thick cut toast was so satisfyingly good. Had a side of savory ham, so delish! Love this cute breakfast place.

jiBHqdNiIMBCpF98ZTdtzQ.text: Best pancakes I've ever had. They're so big and fluffy and the butter is sweet. They just melt in your mouth. The syrup is so good too. Not too sweet but light and such a good flavor!! Between hashbrowns and home fries, I'd have to go with the Home fries. They come with some sweet onions mixed in and it's delicious. Hashbrowns are just a lil mushy under the crispy top layer. I'm not a huge fan of toast (it takes up precious pancake space) but the strawberry preserves it comes with makes it a necessity when eating here. Love the interior and the service!

icid7ONyJuoZ6lk1QnnfLg.text: I came here with my boyfriend Friday morning, it was not very busy. I usually go to the location on downtown, but usually that location is always super pack and the wait is at least 45 min. Food is always amazing here, however the service was not the best. The original location people are super nice and attentive. My server after getting my Oder disappear until she drop off the check, when I was not even done with my food. In my personal opinion I find it a little disrespectful that the servers are rushing you to get out of the restaurant. I hope the service gets better.

AtIM4hClwc1OhqZGvpYAoA.text: This place is a Phoenix staple. Fast service and amazing, fresh food every time I go. I always send everyone to Matt's when they are looking for a good breakfast. Love that they added the new location on camelback!

vgffajfXzX-G2epplYjwqg.text: I went in last week for the first time. I must say, the food at this location is hearty and the wait is short. I ordered an omelet and home fries and they were both delicious. If you're craving an All-American breakfast, you cannot go wrong here. The bacon strips are thick yet crispy so I recommend getting them if they aren't already included in your order. Though the prices are a bit more than affordable, it's well worth it and I plan to return here often.

BTHg-m9cxvo1uWt6J6faTA.text: Staff is great- friendly and efficient. The quality of the food is amazing. Everything was very fresh and came out a lot faster than anticipated. The restaurant was very busy but we had no problem getting a table in about 15 min.

hF4KDo09j5xOYDhuCT9a9A.text: I heard a lot about this place when the first one opened, but I don't do lines. Now that there are more of them I decided to try them. There was no line and not many people in the restaurant. My touchstone is biscuits and gravy, if you can't make those good, you probably can't make anything good.  I had their biscuits and gravy (Tuesday only). The first thing I noticed was that they were very spicy, I like spicy, the wife does not. I like a lot of sausage in my gravy, they had that. I likes me some good biscuits, these were ok. The thing I did not like was that there was not quite enough gravy to finish the biscuits. The eggs I ordered were exactly how I wanted them, the hash browns were pretty good, crispy on the outside kind of like mashed potatoes on the inside.  The did not have salsa. I like salsa on my hash browns. I tried their bacon since everyone raves about it. I would not call it bacon. Bacon has a smoky flavor, their bacon is peppered and because of that tasted like very tender beef jerky.

KAt2NKfQBCVTedCshh2T9Q.text: food was spot on service was friendly and comforting only drawback is no alcohol served... the bottomless coffee was at a nice drinkable temperature and was strong!! the butterrrrrrr. so buttery...yummmmmmmy the 8oz orange juice for kids were served in cute plastic cups! the fruit infused water while you wait in the AZ heat was refreshing
