I gave him the benefit of the doubt the first time and by time #3 I had to leave and go somewhere more friendly. Sorry Matt . . . maybe I will try again another time.

aLp-ZUiRvj6EBd5C_z9jkA.text: I wanted to try this place since it has great reviews. The host that took my name was rude and snoby. It was busy and congested. The menu was very simple and not enough options. We decided to leave and eat breakfast elsewhere.

tBYRkoH3nn04owvgVFBr-w.text: My wife took me to Matt`s Big Breakfast on Camelback this morning. Well, as I always say " if it starts out bad, it usually gets much worse". Damn, I was right. First, they seated us next to where they bring the dirty dishes...really noisy and crowded with servers and dishwashers. They should move this station outside the eating area, for sure. I ordered the cheese omelet with chicken apple sausage. The waitress brought me the hog and chick. Not ever dining here, I thought that it was what I ordered. The omelet was definitely not Big, the potatoes were very salty and the chicken sausage was ok. My wife and I ate our meals and then asked for the check. Wow, it was over $37.00 for an omelet, oatmeal and a $5.95 Five Spot. When I asked the waitress, she said that the cheese was $2.00 extra and the sausage was a $4.95 upcharge. What a ripoff and not Big like the name says at all. The waitress asked me to speak to the manager and at 1st, she reduced the bill by 20 cents...no typo...20 cents and she told me that it was organic and the sausage was locally obtained. Who cares! It was overpriced and not all that tasty. To top off the experience, I have been sick all day since leaving the restaurant and think that I got food poisoning on top of a lousy meal. First and last time to Matt`s Big Breakfast!!

90w8fu-mtOdS01hrRm-aOg.text: Nice alternative to lgoNo! Pkg & good eats! Lot of great alternatives in arcadia/biltmore area.

5JyoGrXThgO9cQooEO1c4g.text: The food was amazing, really filling and satisfying. I would've giving this place a 5 star but the manager or whatever he is, the guy up front is some what of an ass. Jason is his name, noticed he is rude to his servers. And definitely had an attitude when my group came in. Not cool sir, not cool!! The servers and other staff was great and attentive.

IX9Vx436JSDmBWUiBVYygw.text: I finally got a chance to check out this much hyped about breakfast joint. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The wait wasn't long since I got there around 8:15am. I ordered the waffle, and hubby ordered the griddle cakes with a side of their thick cut bacon. Mine order came with 2 strips of bacon already. The waffle tasted ordinary. There was nothing that screams WOW to me. Again, the griddle cakes were just ok. There was nothing extraordinary about them. I feel like eating at a friend's house, not a much raved about breakfast place. The bacon strips were actually delicious!!! I love the peppery taste to it. It's an average place for breakfast, but not one of the best.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get here if you don't live nearby. I would give it 3.5 stars, but I can't with this app. Overall,  it was a very nice experience as far as the staff, but I feel the food could be better for all the 5 star ratings I have read about.

tg6MZW8IeMd9ZGlaAZO3eg.text: Little disappointed in the menu selection also if you order pancakes bring your own syrup. The 2oz you get will hardly moisten the stack additional 2oz syrup costs an additional $1. Other menu items were good.

aF4yHCGY8DFBcnbxMEM1eA.text: We stopped by Matts Big Breakfast on camelback yesterday.  It was nice inside and the employees were friendly. I was excited to eat there because I had heard how busy the other Phoenix location was.  I have to say that the food was average.  It was so greasy and shiney that I thought Rihanna was going to walk in and start singing "shines bright like a diamond".  I hadn't seen such glistening food since living up in the mountains in Montana.  My wife and I had to ask for extra napkins to dab off all the excess oil. I only ate it cause I was starving, but then felt I needed to run home to get my cholesterol pill.  All jokes aside,  it wouldn't be my first choice next time. But I would be willing to try it again in case maybe the cook was a little heavy handed.  One more note to the owners.  The toast was sopping wet in butter too.  I had to tear off the upper layer of bread.  Oil is not the answer for a good breakfast. My wife makes awesome dishes that any restaurant would love and she uses Pam spray.  That's really all you need.  I ordered the 2 egg breakfast with hashbrowns, bacon and toast. + coffe

bvjKI79YjpJhGz8x2ETj1Q.text: Took our large family to this place at noon on a Sunday, they accommodated us rather quickly for how busy they were with an 8 top booth right next to the host station.  Nice surprise.  Ok the negatives, I've never understood the restaurants with limited beverage menus but this place takes it to a new level.  RC. cola.  Nothing. Else. This might work for the millennials crowd searching for some tough love therapy but how about a coupe of more choices? I get the fresh squeezed OJ and honey lemonade as high margin items for Matts kid's college funds but maybe a clear soda and a diet soda of some kind for the young ones.  The food. Breakfast is the meal I love to take family out to so we do a lot of breakfast places.  This is seriously the best breakfast food I have had in the last year.  Waffle was simple with powdered sugar sprinkled but had this sweet flavor that no doubt came from some kind of ingredient in the recipe.  Incredible.  The cheese omelet with $1 add ingredient  of mushrooms. Wow, simple but another winner.  Older Kids had menu standards of "hog & chic" and they raved about it.  I took a bite of the hash browns, not really a hash brown kind of guy but they were unbelievably unique- not crunchy, not greasy, just about right.  The negatives.  Service was pretty sparse. Could be they were overloaded.  They were pleasant and all just not around enough. Sat for long periods with an empty coffee cup trying to make eye contact with someone....bright spot was Lupe.  Attentive to tables that were not even his (ours included) seemed to be looking at the whole place ready to help.  Great part of the crew that lifted the sub par rating of the staff to a passing grade. Funny side note was the manager?host? seating everyone.  Guy was metrosexual hipster caliber right down to the intentional single side front shirt tuck.  I kind of got a kick out of the soup nazi meets Nev Schulman  attitude but the older kids were annoyed....

_2cBrmpghbKT_E68HsbgKw.text: The hash browns were good; inside of them were soft, and the outside crispy. Unfortunately the employees were just as crispy.  They had an edge on them, sharper than the knife I used to cut the sausage patties I ordered. Our waitress gave me anxiety- I literally took my clonazepam at the restaurant. She talked to us super quietly, at about 1,000 mph. The specials? Couldn't tell you because we don't know what the hell she said. So we ate fast, drank our strawberry lemonade  (that was regular lemonade with red dye... I don't know either) and took our check to the front.  The girl at the front had a cute sweater on, but her math skills weren't that cute. We asked her to split the bill but she said "you need to do your own math." Uh okay. So we pull out our calculators and figure it out,  then tell the girl with the cute sweater how to charge us. Good thing we all have iPhones; I don't know what the poor girl would've done if we didn't figure it out. We dodged the hoard of homies blocking the front door and safely made it to the car (granted, we had front row parking)!  We left full, but confused and a little traumatized.

Jw1fIlHKbYaCUnZR-uSsJQ.text: I don't like the service here. The food is so-so. To many young girls working here with NO clue about service. Food We think is way better Dennis because the prices are way better.

lH0XcF9kiM3vivWmZG8rng.text: Every time I go to Matt's, I always have an amazing experience and a superb breakfast. Sunday has to be one of my favorite days there, they have their "Stake and Eggs" special. The meat is tender,juicy and full of flavor. Their potatoes are delicious and well seasoned. The thick cut bacon is delicious. The hog and chick is always a great choice, the fruit preserves that comes with is also great. The griddlecakes are also a good choice, fluffy and sweet. Their milk, coffee, and orange juice are delicious. Its a small place so I recommend you go in early so you can avoid waiting to be seated!

I8aTOZDE5tPcYPR_VFFf2g.text: Excellent breakfast ! Best hash browns I've ever had. The strawberry spread is to die for ! I think it's just strawberries lemon and honey - so delicious. The owner was sweet and kind and checked on every table / I'm very impressed - now let's get Matt's Big Breakfast to Florida

u7fBNdPxcPJndWZ1kWdf4w.text: Amazing breakfast with friendly service and large portions.  Fresh food and great atmosphere!

CNrPULpe-iVIqB4ZGrkueg.text: I don't get it. I was one of few in the place. Ordered the Benedict, which was the special, and a coffee and o.j. They couldn't even get the poached eggs right. If that's your special, get it right. Sadly the poached eggs were overdone. I didn't ask for hard boiled eggs. That doesn't bother me so much however they have the audacity to charge $5 for an o.j., or maybe it was $4.50. Whatever. Same damn thing. I can't imagine the profit margin on the juice. Paid 21 and some change for a poorly executed eggs Benedict "special", a coffee, and an orange juice. Yikes! Congrats on gettin one over on the suckers that think this is a value. This was my first visit. I don't get it and probably won't be back.

3_foaBQlv2Adk82AtLrt9w.text: This is what breakfast should be!  I am a regular at least once a week.  Monday's, the ranchero verde is the best in the state!

SASaM6RedLGR3MeArAC5Eg.text: Never tried the Down town location, because didn't want to do the long wait times!  So after knowing this restaurant just by fame and recognition, went and tried it out.  Showed up and there he was; Big Matt with a big smile in his face; at the door being the hostess of his restaurant.  When do you see than any where else or any other owner with half of his reputation even attempting it.  Just by seeing that site and his humble positive energy I was really ready in trying the service and the food.  I never had an American Breakfast like this before.  Crispy waffles on the outside and gooey and soft in the inside.  Freshly squeezed orange juice and bottomless awesome coffee.  The pork chop was a little dry, but that was about it, everything else was awesome!  Matt does so many things right, stevia on the table, perfect selection of coffee cups made in the USA!, the fresh cut flowers on the table, but the very especial thing, was the staff!!  I think everyone of his staff including the two managers came to check up on us, and ask if they could get something for us!  Spectacular service, restaurants in the Valley should learn from Matt's philosophy!  Everything is honest, fresh, authentic, simple, taught off and  delicate.  Keep growing guys, keep getting better, maybe a Dinner menu with late hours could be a possibility!!  I can Dream right, and Dreams are meant to be lived!  Blessings

GHDwGLu-AwMaFsaXsqntAQ.text: This place rocks. The food is great. The owner is awesome and very friendly. The service is just as good as the one downtown. Since this is less than a mile from my house I will be here a lot. I am so glad they are open in the neighborhood now :)

6plkF3tDMWAn9xi61G1L0g.text: Yea!  Matt's on Camelback is open.  Same menu, great service, great breakfast.  Enjoyed the new location. It has the same buzz as downtown.  So far, wait isn't quite as long.  Try everything once!

Wq32uMijXIJntd5R8l1s-A.text: So today I decided to take my wife and daughter out for breakfast being Valentine's day. I've been to the downtown location and  never had a problem. We decided to try the biltmore location this time and was very  disappointed in there service. The wait time is usually  a bit long but we knew we were going to wait especially being Valentine's, surprisingly we only waiting 45min to be seated. We have waited longer at other times we gone. But from the time we sat down took like 10min to get someone to help us then the part that got my wife  and me more upset is that we had put our order for the food and it' took 45min to get our food. People that were outside waiting were seated and got there food first than us and we asked this waiter if he could check on our food because we been waiting for awhile. HE  went to the back and never heard from him again finally 10min later we got our food. And we never got our receipt either we usually get it half way through our meal. So we had to walk up to the front and ask for it. Was the worse experience at this food chain the food was great but the service was horendous.

GJKo7797gT1abtZn2JpqWg.text: I have been dying to try Matt's Big Breakfast but every time I went to the downtown location it was packed and I had to wait too long,  which increased my curiosity.   I learned of new location of Matt's this morning at 32nd  Street & Camelback and I had to go for it. It was packed on Friday morning at 9:30 and I thought, wow they must have some great food.  I took a look at the menu and was disappointed.  I saw only a few choices and a daily special of scrambled egg surprise.  The waitresses were friendly, the coffee was great but the food was only okay.  The sausage links are nothing I would order again but the bread they used for toast was tasty but it was too wide for my liking at breakfast.  The  preserves were great, but only one selection that day, no strawberry today.  The prices were about the same I find everywhere else around town.  I would have like to see a bigger selection on the menu, like eggs benedict...my curiosity has now been satisfied with my only visit to this restaurant.  Your missing it.
